actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:30 a.m. on July 26, 2024.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Thursday, July 25, 2024 through Sunday, September 8, 2024 as a "district work period."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule on the resolution and the preamble.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1371.
Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 1371. The resolution provides for consideration of H. Res. 1371 under a closed rule.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1376. H. Res. 1371 â€” "Strongly condemning the Biden Administration and its Border Czar, Kamala Harris's, failure to secure the United States border."

actions-list.header: Library of Congress Trust Fund Board
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1 of the Library of Congress Trust Fund Board Act (2 U.S.C. 154), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed Mr. Saul Aaron Fox, Miami Beach, Florida, 5-year term.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees for the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 114(b) of the John of the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development Act (2 U.S.C. 1103) and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed Mr. Michael Joseph Sommers, Alexandria, Virginia, 6-year term.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Tokuda to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rabbi Levi Slonim, Chabad of Binghamton, Vestal, New York.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
